title: Drawing, "Mausoleum (or Library)"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the design -1128, the plan of the surrounding colonnade being square with steeples in the corners. Originally a part of the same sheet as -1132. Colored background. The design was first made on a smaller scale, and lower.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Mausoleum (or Library)".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1133.
